ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Jalpaiguri Women & Child Welfare Society is a non-government Organization, established in 2007 with a mandate to improve the lives of women and children belonging to marginalized community in West Bengal. The main focus of JWCWS is primarily on education and health. The organization is dedicated to create a better place for children belonging to marginalized community by creating friendly platform for overall development of a child. Following activities are being carried out by the organization at their coverage areas: â€¢ Health Awareness Camp. â€¢ Awareness on Environment (save our planet). â€¢ Awareness generation programme on Child Labour. â€¢ Relief Programme. â€¢ Vocational training for Women. â€¢ Non Formal educational Center at Tea Gardens, Jalpaiguri District. Bringing Changes drastically is not so easy as we deal with humans from diversified backgrounds but lots of changes happened due to our presence at grassroots levels. Sensitization at community level happened to some extent. Parents showing interests and working as volunteer. A long way to go and we are dedicated to work for the betterment of women and Children in our Society.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Disaster Management: - Jana Sanghati Kendra (JSK) has conducted immediate relief operations after every major flood and cyclone in West Bengal since the 1990â€™s.It has also done some amount of rehabilitation work and has organised people in post disaster situations to better access and use Government relief. Drinking Water:-JSK has done work on arsenic contamination of drinking water, including installation and popularisation of domestic filters and of community water sources. Education & Literacy: - JSK conducts regular training programmes to educate women especially about their rights as women. It has trained several thousand such women since its inception, averaging about 2-3000 women every year, at present Health & Family Welfare: - JSK runs a mobile health camp under NRHM in Left Wing Extremist affected areas in Purulia district. It also runs similar camps in Sunderbans and has done this in Nadia, North 24 Parganas, Midnapore and Bankura districts. Human Rights: - JSK creates awareness about the Right to Food and Work and about Right to Health, organising meetings and workshops on the same as well as bringing out simple educational literature on these issues Legal Awareness Aid: - JSK provides legal aid to women who are victims of violence. It helps by providing legal aid in about 250 cases every year. Labour & Employment: - JSK helps workers in the unorganised sector, especially women workers by creating awareness about their rights Micro Finance (SHGs):- JSK has worked with the State Government to form and support groups under the SGSY and is now doing the same under NRLM. Panchayati Raj: - JSK has created awareness amongst village people on the Panchayat Raj Act and the way in which gram sabha meetings can be used for local planning. Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation: - JSK takes up programmes such as housing, drinking water, sanitation etc. in order to improve rural infrastructure. Vocational Training: - JSK has trained youth as para medical workers and plans to also train para legal workers to provide services to village people in remote areas Womenâ€™s Development & Empowerment: - JSKâ€™s training programmes amongst women focus on gender issues and empower women. Similar programmes are conducted to sensitise men to gender issues. Youth Affairs: - JSK is now involved in motivating rural youth to take up activities for the betterment of their communities.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Post Graduate Education in Social Work & Psychological Counselling under Vidyasagar University, West Bengal, Identified as Research, Monitoring & Evaluation Organization in the field of Women & Child Development, Rural Development etc. by Government of India and Government of West Bengal, Expertise in Training on Social Legislation, Social Defence, Child Protection, HIV/AIDS etc.Long experience in Social Intervention Programme like Managing Shelter, Providing Counselling, Organizing Vocational Training & Facilitating Re-integration of the socially excluded people. The Institute is engaged in organizing Anti-Trafficking Activities in Source Areas in partnership with Save the Children the Institute also works in partnership with the Central & State Government, UNICEF, Iris Aid, Oxfam GB, USAID, DFID, CHILDLINE India Foundation etc. The Institute participated in devising Policy Frame for the State on Juvenile Justice Issues, Human trafficking, Ageing, Child Marriage etc. The Institute is member of the Central Advisory Committee on combating trafficking of Women & Children and Child Prostitution and Convener of Non-Official Advisory Board on Trafficking to the State Level. The Institute as a Member of the Task Force played a key role to prepare and implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for Repatriation of Children of Bangladeshi Origin. The Institute conducted Research and Survey Work on various social problems like Women in prison, women vendors, dowry, child marriage, Women in Un-organized Sector, Child Protection, Age Care and various facets of Violence against Women etc. under the auspices of the Department ofWomen and Child Development, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, UNICEF, ICSSR, NISD etc. The Institute also conducted quite a few Evaluation and Action Research on various issues like Sericulture and Development, Rural Sanitation, Rural Development Programmes, Disaster Mitigation Programmes sponsored by the World Bank, Oxfam (India) Trust, Ministry of Rural Development, Save the Children, and many other Government and Non-Government Organizations. The Institute fucntioned as a Nodal Agency for Monitoring of the activities of NGOs funded by the CSWB, DWCD and MSJE. The Institute organizes Training and Capacity Building Activities for the functionaries of Government and Non-Government Social Development Organization mainly in areas of Child Development and Child Protection, Family Counselling, Juvenile Justice, Reporting and Documentation etc. The Institute has rich experience in the following fields of activities: Social Survey and Research, Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis including usage of PRA and case tools, Monitoring, Evaluation and Training, Public Consultation, Negotiation and Community Mobilization, Stakeholder Analysis, Liveliohoods Analysis, Capacity Building, Shelter, Counselling and Rehabilitation, Reporting and Documentation, Social Work Education (Masters Course under University) etc. The Institute works as a Nodal Agency for Monitoring and Evaluation in the Implementation of Schemes of Ministry of Women and Child Development, The Central Social Welfare Board, Ministry of Rural Development, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, UNICEF, NIPCCD etc. The Institute played Consultative role in Drafting of the State Rules of Major Legislations like Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2006, Prohibition of Child Marriage Act, 2006 and Maintenance & Welfare of Parents and Senior Citizens Act, 2007.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Kalikata Bidhan Manab Samity KBMBS is a Social Welfare association working in Howrah District since 1983 The organization takes up different activities along with other institutions and NGOs. The main activities undertaken by the organization in recent past are community Health care services through house visit by the health workers and giving the basic informations on preventive health, curative health care services through medical clinic in the head office Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme RNTCP MCTC with the Govt. of West Bengal and Direct Observe Treatment CBDOTs through CARE West Bengal to control TB, Forming and Maintaining of Peoples Organization Micro credit through SHGs, Disaster Management through Relief work HIV AIDs awareness programme, Lowcost Housing and Sanitation programme etc Our work for the past 28years in this area has given us lots of new ideas The support and cooperation from NGOs Other likeminded Institutions and government departments encourages us to carry forward the work incorporating the lessons from the past Vision The Kalikata Bidhan Manab Samity KBMBS envisions an INDIA wherein people Are assured of clean air, water and empowerment are able to fulfill their basic needs are able to get proper education are able to develop themselves to lead a better livehood do not suffer from any preventable disease are able to manage their health needs are able to control the forces which cause ill health enjoy dignity and equality and are partners in decisions that affect them, irrespective of caste, creed, religion or economic status and respect human life and hold and nurture it to grow into its fullness. Mission In order to realize the vision, KBMBS endeavors to promote community development, understood as a process of enabling the people especially the poor and the marginalized to be collectively responsible to attain and maintain their Basic Needs and demand Freedom of accessibility to all development aspects as a right and Ensure availability of health & Medical care of reasonable quality at reasonable cost. Programme activities The programme activities of KBMBS during the period can be grouped under following categories Comprehensive Community Health RNTCP & DOTs Micro Finance NonFormal Education Programme Women Welfare Programmes Youth Welfare Programmes Social Welfare Programmes Child Welfare Relief Activities Administration Cultrual Programmes Agricultural Programmes Fishery Activities Vocational Training Book cloth and Blankets distribution Lowcost Housing sanitation smokeless chulla Environment and sanitation with social forestry Awareness Generation Camp we also start Pathology Radiology and ECG clinic

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Bratyajon, a Bengali group theatre, is the brainchild of ace playwright and actor-director Bratya Basu. He has formed and steered the group from 2008. The productions under the banner of Bratyajon have been influenced by the learning, motivation, inspitration and experiences of the renowned playwright and theatre artist himself. Some of the important productions of Bratyajon are Ruddhasangeet (2009), Canvasser (2011) and Byomkesh (2011). Apart from theatrical production, the group is active in many associated fields. An important activity of the group is to organize an annual theatre festival. The â€˜Bratyajon Natya Aayojan 2012â€™ was organized at the Academy of Fine Arts, Kolkata from 16th to 19th February. Bratyajon confers â€˜Bishnu Basu Smriti Puroskarâ€™ in the loving memory of the late Bishnu Basu and also organizes â€˜Bishnu Basu Memorial Lecturesâ€™. Other activities include theatre publications comprising a theatre journal and participation in the book fair. Bratyajon conducts theatre workshops for children which culminate in a stage performance.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The group Kalyani Kalamandalam was established in june 1995 by a group of energetic and creative mined young fellows who are exploring new directions in theatre. Our group members are energetic and creative minded artist. Our aim is to create a new theatrical language in Indian Theatre. The group has spread its activities in various ways such as drama, theatre workshop, childrens theatre & festival, publishing theatre magazine, organizing open air theatre festival. Some of the major theatre productions are Ebong Indrajit, Dhorai Charit Manas, Romeo Jeannette, Malua Sundarir Pala, Manushi, Paglir Danga & Oedipus. We have participated in the major theatre festivals like Bharat Rang Mohotsab, National Theatre Festival-Mumbai, State Theatre Festival, National Theatre Festival-Amritsar & International French Drama Festival-Dhaka. We are responsible towards our work today, tomorrow and forever.

ngoList.title: KALYANI NATYACHARCHA KENDRA
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kalyani Natyacharcha Kendra has been formally constituted in 1996 and later it has become a full-fledged Theatre Organization in 1997. Since its inception it has been absolutely engaged in promoting theatre appreciation in and around Kalyani-a University city some 48 kms away from Kolkata. The organization beleives that GOOD THEATRE IS ESSENTIAL FOR GOOD LIVING. Initially it has organized 6 annual Multilingual theatre festivals in the month of November and December till 2001 in collaboration with EZCC and NANDIKAR-a Kolkata based Theatre Group. From 2002 onwards the organization has been holding a 10 day theatre festival from 17 to 26 December every year in Ritwik Sadan- a well equipped theatre auditorium in Kalyani having 994 seats. The 15th theatre festival has taken place during 17 to 26 December 2009. In the festivals- each year- a number of 15 renowned Theatre Groups from Kolkata and Districts participate.This Non-Kolkata based Theatre Festival is only of its kind in West Bengal-where not a single ticket is PUSH-SOLD. And it is also a pride to mention that almost all the shows become HOUSEFULL in this festival. That means approximately 12 to 14 thousand spectators come to the auditorium willingly during the festival days to witness 14 to 15 plays. The organization also produces play-productions-conducts seminar on theatre related issues-organizes acting workshops with the help of eminent theatre personalities. It has 8 major play-productions in its present repertoire- CHILEKOTHAR SEPAI-NOKSHI KANTHAR MAATH-ASWACHARIT-KHOWABNAMA-DASYU KENARAM-HARIYE JAY MANUSH-BABORER PRARTHANA AND MEYETI. It has also organized 2 childrens theatre workshops so far and 2 childrens plays have come out-BHALOBASI SABUJ and SINGI DESHE BUBAI TUBAI. The group also publishes an annual theatre journal NATYAMANAN and 10 Theatre Bulletins named NATUKE in the month of December.As a regular theatre group-that has an annual average of 40 stage performances- it receives Grants under various schemes from the Ministry of Culture. The organization has started to construct its own theatre building on its own 2800 sq.ft. land for which Ministry of Culture has sanctioned building grant amounting to Rs1500000. Once the long-dreamt-of-BUILDING is constructed- the organization will start INSTITUTIONALISED THEATRE ACTIVITIES specially among the children. Eminent theatre personalities like Tapas Sen-Khaled Choudhury-Rudraprasad and Swatilekha Sengupta-Goutam and Debsankar Halder-Suman Mukhopadhyay-Bratya Basu have worked in some of our play-productions. The group has travelled in all major cities in our country with its productions. It has also participated in various theatre festivals with its productions including NSD festival and Mumbai Neheru Centre festival. Almost all the performers of the group generally spend 7 hours daily for rehearsals, training and other theatre related activities. The group has 9 WHOLETIME THEATRE WORKERS. It has also a rich LIBRARY of 600+ books on THEATRE. Kalyani Natyacharcha Kendra aspires to be a professional Theatre Group in near future.
